column4: too dual boot from my external hard drive, do i need to format it?!!

Is there anyway to dual boot ubuntu on external hard drive without formatting it??
hmmm...
then what is formatting i might have it wrong..
formatting is when create a fresh filesystem (empty)
don't delete that image just yet though
use torrent to patch up that file and it'll be the same thing

find the torrent file that matches your iso, put broken iso into directory where torrent will dl the torrent, prog should automatically fetch the parts of the file that are wrong and you won't have to do a 700mb download again

gl then :P
it says on the guide im reading to diconnect my internal hd during installation to my external, how do i disconnect and internal hd? The only thing i have done is replaced my RAM..
what? If you just installed more ram to your computer, then you should do nothing like that, it should work when you power your computer on again...
no im just wondering how do you disconnect and internal hd
well, you have to go into the computer, unplug the IDE cable and the power plug and you should be set
yes, to remove the hdd, you must remove ide and power plug connected to hdd..
but do all this with the power cable to the computer also unplugged :)
